containing_words.word: 中國國民黨革命委員會

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu was still for moderation and concessions to the Wuhan Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 陳獨秀卻依然主張對武漢國民黨的妥協退讓。

sentences.english: Its final aim was to repulse the third anti-communist upsurge launched by the KMT diehards.
sentences.chinese: 其最終目的是打退國民黨頑固派發起的三次反共高潮。

sentences.english: A great number of the Nationalist Party leaders came from Guangdong Province, the cradle of the party.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨發跡於廣東，也造就了大批粵籍黨國領袖。

sentences.english: But resistance to Japan is not finished and done for, nor are all Kuomintang members scoundrels.
sentences.chinese: 但是抗日仍然是有希望的，國民黨裏面也不都是壞人。

sentences.english: After Sun Yat- sen came Chiang Kai- shek, who brought the Kuomintang' s military power to its zenith.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石代替孫中山，創造了國民黨的全盛的軍事時代。

sentences.english: After 1947, the war began to go against KMT.
sentences.chinese: 一九四七年以後，戰爭開始對國民黨不利。

sentences.english: Again, Lu also showed his leftist mind in his criticism of the Guomingtang authorities.
sentences.chinese: 其次，魯迅的左傾也體現在對國民黨當局的批判中。

sentences.english: I did not expect to be detained by the KMT in Xi'an, held in Xi'an reformatory.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到在西安關卡被國民黨扣留，關押在西安感化院。

sentences.english: But the Taiwanese people had lost all faith in he KMT, and refused it another chance.
sentences.chinese: 但百姓對國民黨已失望透頂，不再給它機會。

sentences.english: The husband year calm state ever was Kuomintang force advocate the clique that fight day.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫年定邦曾是國民黨力主抗日派。

sentences.english: The Kuomintang government of Japan's aggressive policy of non-resistance.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨政府對日本的侵略採取不抵抗政策。

sentences.english: Although it had many corrupt officials, the Kuomintang managed enterprises better than we do.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨貪官污吏多得很，但是辦企業比我們好。

sentences.english: Stand tall red political power in the land, confrontation with the kuomintang regime.
sentences.chinese: 紅色政權巍然屹立在中華大地上，同國民黨政權對峙。

sentences.english: The Guomindang soldiers searched the village for a wounded Red Army man.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨士兵搜查了那個村莊要找一個受傷的紅軍戰士。

sentences.english: Kuomintang Chongqing government also got pertinent information.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨重慶政府也得到了相關情報。

sentences.english: On July 15, 1946, he was assassinated in kunming by Kuomintang thugs.
sentences.chinese: 一九四六年七月十五日在昆明被國民黨特務暗殺。

definition: DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
Green Standard Army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
